import { ComboboxMulti } from '@looker/components'
import { Editor, excludedProps } from '@looker/storybook'
import { ArgsTable, Meta } from '@storybook/addon-docs'
import basicStory from '!!raw-loader!./Basic'
import controlledStory from '!!raw-loader!./Controlled'
import controlledInputValueStory from '!!raw-loader!./ControlledInputValue'
import customIndicatorStory from '!!raw-loader!./CustomIndicator'
import noIndicatorStory from '!!raw-loader!./NoIndicator'
import listLayout from '!!raw-loader!./ListLayout'

<Meta component={ComboboxMulti} title="Docs/ComboboxMulti" />

# ComboboxMulti

For the vast majority of use cases, you should be using the [Select input](?path=/docs/docs-select--docs) instead of rendering ComboboxMulti directly. ComboboxMulti is the lower-level abstraction used for rendering Select.

<Editor code={basicStory} />

## Controlled Component

<Editor code={controlledStory} />

## Controlled Input Value

<Editor code={controlledInputValueStory} />

## Customizing the indicator

Open the select menu to see the custom indicator appear on hover.

<Editor code={customIndicatorStory} />

## Hiding the indicator

You can disable the option indicator entirely by setting `indicator={false}` on the ComboboxMultiList component.

<Editor code={noIndicatorStory} />

## Customizing the list width

You can set either `width`, `min-width`, or `max-width` on the ComboboxList to customize how much space the combox will take up when the list overlay is open.

<Editor code={listLayout} />

## Props

<ArgsTable of={ComboboxMulti} exclude={excludedProps} />
